description.displayText: We have known Amy for about 3 years and can't say enough good about her. Our boys are 6 and 3 1/2 and they adore her! She is completely responsible, reliable and punctual. Most importantly, she truly cares. She gets to know each child, and patiently and intentionally learns how to interact/relate in a meaningful way. We've been blessed to have Amy in our lives!
description.originalText: We have known Amy for about 3 years and can't say enough good about her. Our boys are 6 and 3 1/2 and they adore her! She is completely responsible, reliable and punctual. Most importantly, she truly cares. She gets to know each child, and patiently and intentionally learns how to interact/relate in a meaningful way. We've been blessed to have Amy in our lives!

description.displayText: We have been so thrilled to have Amy caring for our 2.5 year old for the past few months! Amy has been reliable, communicative, and thoughtful  every step of the way. She and our daughter developed the sweetest bond, and it was a joy to know they were playing creatively - whether through art projects, singing, playing pretend, or carefully exploring the outside world.  Amy was even wonderful with our energetic and boisterous large dog (who can be more of a handful than the kid at times). We are bummed Amy is relocating because we'd love to keep working with her - the next family that she's with will be lucky indeed!
description.originalText: We have been so thrilled to have Amy caring for our 2.5 year old for the past few months! Amy has been reliable, communicative, and thoughtful  every step of the way. She and our daughter developed the sweetest bond, and it was a joy to know they were playing creatively - whether through art projects, singing, playing pretend, or carefully exploring the outside world.  Amy was even wonderful with our energetic and boisterous large dog (who can be more of a handful than the kid at times). We are bummed Amy is relocating because we'd love to keep working with her - the next family that she's with will be lucky indeed!

description.displayText: Where do I even start?! I cannot recommend Amy enough! Any family will be lucky to have her. She has many strengths: she is a great communicator with both adults and children, extremely dependable, thorough and creative! if I had to pick one superpower, it's her incredible patience. Amy cared for our now 8yo and 4yo kiddos for almost 2 years and through tantrums, sibling disputes and big emotions, Amy calmly taught them how to self regulate and use words. She is also a performer, and enthusiastically took apart in plays with the nuttiest plot lines with great gusto. If you're looking for someone who is to-the-core kind and reliable, look no further.

She is also a performer, and enthusiastically took apart in plays with the nuttiest plot lines with great gusto. If you're looking for someone who is to-the-core kind and reliable, look no further.

description.displayText:
Amy was a pleasure to have take care of our 9 months old son. She is extremely pleasant, very calm, does not get bothered by a cranky baby, my son loved spending time with her and was well taken care of. Amy is very flexible when it comes to parent's asks, she also has a beautiful singing voice that I got to listen to while working upstairs. I also got some great pictures of my son from walks they took together and will cherish them as his first experiences with grass and flowers. 
Will absolutely hire Amy again if i need backup care, too bad she was not available for a full time commitment.

description.displayText: Amy took care of our 2 year old son for several months. She is thoughtful and creative. She took initiative and needed minimal guidance. I would absolutely hire her again if I need.
